intro: Coussarea racemosa, commonly known as the coral tree, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Asia and is characterized by its striking clusters of bright red or orange flowers. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and can grow as a shrub or small tree. Its bark is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. The flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and birds, contributing to its ecological significance.
